organization.description:
Weather, temperature, carbon, water, soil and all other kinds of climate related open data.  Including (but not limited to) data about:

 * the atmosphere
 * the weather
 * air quality
 * temperature
 * the ocean
 * rivers
 * water levels
 * water quality
 * carbon emissions
 * pollution
 * soil erosion
 * biodiversity

For background information see [blog on article on IPCC data](http://blog.okfn.org/2007/11/20/the-ipcc-data-distribution-centre-environmental-data-licensing/), [the wiki](http://wiki.okfn.org/OpenEnvironmentalData), and [this other blog article](http://blog.okfn.org/2009/12/05/climate-change-climate-sceptics-and-open-data/). If you would like to help update or maintain this group, please [get in touch](http://okfn.org/contact)!

The climate data group is supported by the [Open Knowledge Foundation](http://www.okfn.org), [Clear Climate Code](http://clearclimatecode.org/) and the scientists at [Real Climate](http://www.realclimate.org/).

### Existing Lists of Climate Datasets to Migrate Here

 * <http://www.realclimate.org/index.php/data-sources/>
 * <http://ergodd.zoo.ox.ac.uk/eden/index.php?p=10>
 * <http://wiki.okfn.org/OpenEnvironmentalData/DatabaseOfEmissionsData>
 * <http://wiki.okfn.org/OpenEnvironmentalData>
organization.title: Climate Data
organization.name: climatedata

name: eu-eper
notes:
### About

Overview:

> EPER is the European Pollutant Emission Register - the first European-wide register of industrial emissions into air and water.

> It gives you access to information on the annual emissions of approx. 9,200 industrial facilities in the 15 Member States of the EU as well as Norway and Hungary mostly for the year 2001 and approx. 12,000 facilities in the 25 Member States of the EU and Norway for the year 2004.

> It lets you group information easily, by pollutant, activity (sector), air and water (direct or via a sewerage system) or by country.

> It is also possible to see detailed data on individual facilities.

Full data dump is available in Microsoft Access format (MDB):

 * <http://eper.ec.europa.eu/eper/files/EPER_dataset_15-08-2008.zip>

Also available in Keyhole Markup Language (KML):

 * <http://eper.ec.europa.eu/eper/files/EPER.kmz>

Possible to extract XML for [EU15](http://stats.oecd.org/glossary/detail.asp?ID=6805) countries, [EU25](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/EU25) countries or any given EU country in a given year (currently either 2001 or 2004):

 * <http://eper.ec.europa.eu/eper/extract_data.asp?i=>

### Data

Main fields are:

 * NationalID
 * ReportedYear
 * ParentCompanyName
 * FacilityName
 * PostCode
 * City
 * GeographicCoordinateSystem
 * Longitude
 * Latitude
 * NaceCode
 * RegulatoryBodies
 * NoOfInstallations
 * OperatingHours
 * ContactName
 * PhoneNumber
 * FaxNumber
 * Email
 * NosePCode
 * EmissionType
 * PollutantName
 * Method
 * EmissionValue

Documentation can be found at:

 * <http://eper.ec.europa.eu/eper/Gaps.asp?i=>

### Openness

Free to be re-used as long as attribution is given. The [Copyright notice](http://ec.europa.eu/geninfo/legal_notices_en.htm#copyright) on the European Commission website states:

> Reproduction is authorised, provided the source is acknowledged, save where otherwise stated.

> Where prior permission must be obtained for the reproduction or use of textual and multimedia information (sound, images, software, etc.), such permission shall cancel the above-mentioned general permission and shall clearly indicate any restrictions on use.
title: European Pollutant Emission Register (EPER)
